result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Recommendation:    13CF56 -- Ct 2 60 days RCJ, Ct 4 $100 + court costs
                                    13CF835 -- 18 mos WPS, 18 mos ES imposed/stayed, 3 yrs probation consecutive to 14CF588.
                                    14CF588 -- prison
Sentencing argument
BTC: 13CF56  - Ct 2  60 days RCJ
                             Ct 4  $200 + court costs
           13CF835 - 18 mos WPS 18 mos ES
            14CF327 - dismiss and read-in
             14CF588 - Count 1   3 yrs WPS 3 yrs ES consecutive to 13CF835
                                 Count 2   9 mos RCJ concurrent with Count 1
                                 Counts 3, 4, 5   3 yrs WPS 2 yrs ES concurrent with each other and Count 1

appropriate counseling, follow through

court costs

Upon plea to 13CF59-Cts 2 & 4, Cts 1 & 3 are DRI. Ct 2 60 days RCJ consec to any other time, Ct 4-$100 + cc. 13CF835-pl to charge, state rec 3 yrs I/S WPS equal bifurcation. 3 yrs prob consec to prison time the State will recommend in 14CF588 w/conditons to include no alc/cs-AODA and other approp conditions. 14CF327 is DRI.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered

Defendant Cedrick D Jones in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Defendant Cedrick D Jones in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

Defendant Cedrick D Jones in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Defendant Cedrick D Jones in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Both the State and defense have filed bond motions. The State in 14CF588 to adj trial and defense regarding bond modification. The Defense objects to the State's request. 
The State indicates the issue is the firearm that was allegedly handled by the deft and tossed as he was running from police. Defense asked that the weapon be tested for fingerprints and DNA. Fingerprints were done but DNA was not due to the crime lab's reluctance to test the weapon. The State was able to convince the lab to test same, a swab was taken and it has been submitted to the crime lab. Defense isn't sure they actually asked that it be done but they did inquire. Defense objects to the adjournment citing the length of time deft has been in custody. Deft was granted a signature bond in 14CF588 so he is no longer being held on that matter. If the State's request is granted, Mr. Johnson asks to withdraw due to his limited ability to provide an adequate defense due to his new position.

Defense asks that bonds be modified from cash to just co-signature bonds with deft's mother with the GPS requirement in place. Although defense requested those bonds be converted to cash because deft was going to be held in custody, the deft's mother has not been able to post cash as requested and defense asks that bonds be converted to simply co-signature bonds. The State objects to the bond modification as requested citing the charges deft is now facing.

BTC: The Court believes the State's request for 'touch evidence' is not timely State's request is denied. Bond modification as requested by the defense is denied.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
